channel.title: Life Universe and Everything
channel.description: Recent content on Life Universe and Everything

item.title: Elastic Search Cluster Setup
item.description: Preparation Step 1 Get an ubuntu box - you can find version compatibility On Azure Using ubuntu 16.04 LTS 1) Create a machine with public ip(master node) 2) Create other machines (data/ingest nodes w/o public IP) Step 2 Install Oracle Java. Compatibility matrix in same link as above. > sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade > sudo apt-get install software-properties-common > sudo add-apt-repository ppa:linuxuprising/java > sudo apt-get update > sudo add-apt-repository ppa:webupd8team/java > sudo apt-get update > sudo apt-get install oracle-java8-installer Set JAVA_HOME

item.title: About Me
item.description: I’m a generalist software developer who loves programming / design & analysis of algorithms. My work has mostly been around writing services - Android RIL layer, web services etc. I’m currently working for Microsoft IDC, Bengaluru. I’m, in general, interested in sports, programming and wasting time thinking about random stuff but what I end up doing mostly is procrastination(you’ll see soon) for some reason :) I both started and stopped blogging in college - maintaining it was too much work (you see it now).

item.title: Scala Setup
item.description: Preparation Step 1 - Java Installation Since scala runs on JVM we need java, it’s a good idea to install whole of jdk with it. Issuing command below will bring both JRE and Java to your machine. sudo apt-get install openjdk-8-jdk Step 2 - Download Scala You can get scala from Scala website - Go here. Scroll down the page and get a debian package, with extension as .deb. You can click on it to download - or just use the command below.

item.title: Contact
item.description: Shoot an email to (concat “kandpaleatesh” “@” “gmail” “.” “com”). I try to reply as soon as possible !

item.title: Contact
item.description: Enable later when API is ready ! <div class="pure-u-1 pure-u-md-1-3"> <label for="last-name">Last Name</label> <input id="last-name" class="pure-u-23-24" type="text"> </div> <div class="pure-u-1 pure-u-md-1-3"> <label for="email">E-Mail</label> <input id="email" class="pure-u-23-24" type="email" required> </div> <div class="pure-u-1 pure-u-md-1-3"> <label for="city">City</label> <input id="city" class="pure-u-23-24" type="text"> </div> <div class="pure-u-1 pure-u-md-1-3"> <label for="state">State</label> <select id="state" class="pure-input-1-2"> <option>AL</option> <option>CA</option> <option>IL</option> </select> </div> </div> <fieldset class="pure-group"> <input type="text" class="pure-input-1-2" placeholder="A title"> <textarea class="pure-input-1-2" placeholder="Your message"></textarea> </fieldset> <button type="submit" class="pure-button pure-button-primary">Send</button>

item.title: Contact
(Hu)go Template Primer
item.description: Hugo uses the excellent go html/template library for its template engine. It is an extremely lightweight engine that provides a very small amount of logic. In our experience that it is just the right amount of logic to be able to create a good static website. If you have used other template systems from different languages or frameworks you will find a lot of similarities in go templates. This document is a brief primer on using go templates.
